# Introduction
This is a shiny application. It requires a shiny server to run properly.
The latter could be as part of Rstudio or some cloud server (e.g. shinyapps.io, quarto).
Without it will not render properly, but I used it hear to illustrate how quarto can be used to define a simple shiny app.

```{r}
#| panel: sidebar
vars = names(iris)[-5]
selectInput('xcol', 'x', vars)
selectInput('ycol', 'y', vars, selected=vars[[2]])
numericInput('k', '#clusters', 3, min=1, max=9)
```

```{r}
#| panel: fill
plotOutput('plot1')
```


Notice that we have to define the `context` of the following code block.
```{r}
#| context: server
#| label: server_code

d <- reactive({
  iris[,c(input$xcol, input$ycol)]
})

output$plot1 <- renderPlot({
  plot(d(), col=iris$Species)
})
```
